chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen M Rodriquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent

superMiscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--no acts or threats of violence
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--to submit to random urinalyses
--to comply with DNA sample provision 

Arresting Agency: WTPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
case called at 9:36am. [MK]
Defendant Stephen M Rodriquez in court, in custody, with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.  ADA Moncia Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited as to the felony counts.
Mr. Rodriguez waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
Service of Information admitted, reading waived
Constitutional rights reviewed; elements recited; pleas of " Guilty " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Rodriguez guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2, #3, #4.

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Rodriguez to 5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent. 

The Court finds that Mr. Rodriguez is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Rodriguez is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 The Court gives 32 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--no acts or threats of violence
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--to submit to random urinalyses
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Statute 941.291 body armor prohibition imposed; penalties recited
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 10:41am.
the Defendant from Kettle Moraine Institution for the 1/2/15 Plea/Sentencing Hearing
